lines.text: I used to be in love with answers, but since I've known you I'm just as astounded by questions. Answers make you wise, questions make you human.

[singing]
When you know there's someone loving you... and you know there's someone you love, too... and they're not the same, what do you do? Go to sleep, girl. Go to sleep. Go to sleep. Close your eyes and hide from every care... When you wake up, they may not be there. But tell me how can I sleep? Tell me who could? When you see your whole life tangled up good. I could drink. I could weep. Oh, but how can I sleep?
Thank you, Mrs. Hatch. You've done the impossible. You've given my depression... a depression.
Why, Daisy, you're a bloody miracle!

I don't, but you do, and you like what she's like. And you don't like what I'm like, so I know we're not alike. I know what I'm like, and I don't like it either. Because I'm like nothing and like nobody, and nothing or nobody can change me. I'm stuck as I am.
Have you ever been to England, Miss Gamble?
No, I'm afraid of flying. Well, not so much of flying, more so of the "no smoking" sign!
Could anyone among us, have an inkling or a clue... what magic feats of wizardry and voodoo you can do?
Healthy. Adjusted. And no character. I mean no character of any kind. I mean, not even any, uh, characteristics!
What size family do you come from?
Well my father's pretty fat but, um, the rest of us...
That's the first time in my life I've felt like the opposite sex.
Oh, God, why didn't you make woman first when you were fresh?
All the time, he was thinking about someone else... me!
You're not going to go on using *my* head for a motel!
The first finger that touches me, I cut off!
Melinda's soul inside of you? God! What a housing shortage!
You're incredible.
Top two percent.
You? That's incest!
We're only related by marriage.
What other way is there?
Get off my roof!
My name... is Melinda. Melinda Winifred Wayne Tentrees. And I am *appalled* and *stunned* at this outrageous inquisition!

[upon Melinda arriving at the table where he is playing roulette]
Melinda... what a questionable surprise.
I opened the window, but you fell out.

Doctor, do you think, I mean, can people really be hypnotized out of something. You know, something like smoking?... It's stuck in the dictionary... I mean, can you see how yellow my fingers are? Look...
I beg your pardon?
Aren't you looking for a piece of paper with an address on it?
Yes.
Don't you have a dictionary?
Well, yes.

Well, just see if it's in there... um... You see, the other night I heard this discussion going on in the bathtub - on the radio - and, um, this man said, uh... It's under 'X'... He said you could be, you know, hypnotized out of it without getting something else instead. You know, like, uh, fat or, uh, nervous, or acne.
Miss... uh...
Gamble
What about this address?
Isn't it the one you were looking for?
Yes, but uh, how did you do it?
I don't know. I just saw you looking around for something and I wondered what it was and... I knew.
Rubbish! Pure, unadulterated rubbish!
I'm an addict! I'm an addicted addict! I can't stop unless somebody like you can make me.
Love is the exception to every rule, is it not?
How was the smoking last night and today?
Oh, much better. If the phone hadn't rung this morning I wouldn't have smoked until breakfast.
Do you always smoke on the telephone?
Well, you got to. I mean, You just *got* to. I-I mean, you got this hand left over doing nothing. Of course, I usually hear it before it rings and light up ahead of time.
In England, they drive on the left.
Boy, those English sure have a lot of guts.
No. It's the law.
...and 20 lectures on planned parenthood - 10 on how to and 10 on how not to.
Aren't you happy?
Yeah. I'm-I'm very happy.
Why don't you smile?
I am.
I like your smile, Warren. *Super*.
Comes the dawn, I may not feel the same.

[conscience]
Comes the dawn, he may not know your name.
In the sunlight, who can see a flame?
This is a fantasy, Conrad!
To six hundred million Mohammed-ens, so is Christmas!
They're geraniums... any minute now.
Oh?
Miss Gamble says that she can make flowers grow faster.
Faster than what, Miss Gamble?

Well, you know, *faster*. Um, I mean, my friend Muriel and I, we plant our seeds on the same day and, uh, I don't know, my flowers come charging out of the pot as if the police were after them and... poor Muriel.
Do you ever talk to your flowers, Miss Gamble?
Talk to them? What do you think I am? Crazy?
Do you?
You don't think I should?
Very good, Miss Gamble, and very *irritating*.
Man cannot live by *bed* alone.
Do most people think it was a man, or a woman?
Yes. Most people think it was a man or a woman.
Wouldn't I be the late, great me if I knew how?
Madmoiselle, where in 'ell can you be?
...wrapped in mink or saran...
What is this? Extrasensory torture?
